meanings.definition: Preventing or reducing knocking in internal combustion engines.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic recommended using antiknock fuel for the car engine.
meanings.sent2: The antiknock properties of the fuel helped the engine run smoothly.
meanings.sent3: The antiknock fuel made the engine sound like a purring kitten.
meanings.sent4: Her calm demeanor acted as an antiknock shield against the chaos around her.
meanings.sent5: The antiknock feature of the fuel was like a protective barrier for the engine.

meanings.definition: A substance added to fuel to prevent knocking in internal combustion engines.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic poured antiknock into the fuel tank to improve engine performance.
meanings.sent2: The antiknock additive in the fuel prevented engine knocking.
meanings.sent3: The antiknock substance danced happily in the fuel tank.
meanings.sent4: His words were like antiknock, smoothing out the rough edges of the conversation.
meanings.sent5: The antiknock component in the fuel was the engine's best friend during long drives.
